bt.test.protocol

Class ProtocolTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • bt.test.protocol.ProtocolTest

  • public class ProtocolTest
extends Object
    Provides convenient means for simplifying creation of protocol test suites.
    Since:
    1.1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assertDecoded(int expectedBytesConsumed, Message expectedMessage, byte[] data)
      Assert that the provided data contains sufficient bytes for successful decoding and that the decoded message matches the expected message.

      Assert that the provided data does not contain enough bytes for successful decoding and the message type can not be determined.
      void assertInsufficientDataAndNothingConsumed(Class<? extends Message> expectedType, byte[] data)
      Assert that the provided data does not contain enough bytes for successful decoding and the message type is equal to the expected type.

      • assertInsufficientDataAndNothingConsumed

        public void assertInsufficientDataAndNothingConsumed(byte[] data)
                                              throws Exception
        Assert that the provided data does not contain enough bytes for successful decoding and the message type can not be determined.
        Parameters:
        data - Raw message data (most probably truncated)
        Throws:

        Since:
        1.1

      • assertInsufficientDataAndNothingConsumed

        public void assertInsufficientDataAndNothingConsumed(Class<? extends Message> expectedType,
                                                     byte[] data)
                                              throws Exception
        Assert that the provided data does not contain enough bytes for successful decoding and the message type is equal to the expected type. When the expected type is null, this method behaves exactly as its' overloaded version assertInsufficientDataAndNothingConsumed(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        expectedType - Expected message type
        data - Raw message data (most probably truncated)
        Throws:
        Exception
        Since:
        1.1

      • assertDecoded

        public void assertDecoded(int expectedBytesConsumed,
                          Message expectedMessage,
                          byte[] data)
                   throws Exception
        Assert that the provided data contains sufficient bytes for successful decoding and that the decoded message matches the expected message.
        Parameters:
        expectedBytesConsumed - Exact number of bytes that is expected to be consumed during the decoding
        expectedMessage - Expected message
        data - Raw message data
        Throws:
        Exception
        Since:
        1.1
